question: You have recently ordered an item through the Internet, but are not happy with the purchase. Write to the company. In your letter:– describe what you purchased,– explain why you are not happy with the purchase,– tell them what you would like them to do about the situation.Dear Sir or Madam,
text: My name is Krunal Gandhi. I recently purchased sports shoes from your online store. I am writing this letter to express my dissatisfaction regarding my purchase.

I purchased sports shoes and my invoice number is 12345. I am a regular customer of your online store as I mostly prefer online shopping. So far my experience of shopping from your store has been good but unfortunately, I am not happy with the recent purchase. I ordered Nike sports shoes, red colour. The shoes are perfect from the outside but the soles are found damaged. I specifically purchased this brand because of the shock-absorbing technology which is ideal for running and walking. Hence, these shoes are not suitable for my use. This is quite an unpleasant experience as I was looking forward to starting my walk  today.

I would like you to arrange for the return of the item and to process a full refund as soon as possible.  If you need to book a time for a courier to collect the parcel, you can contact me at my email address but the process must be completed within the next two days as I will be out of town from next week.
